attributes.action: Debate creating memorials to commemorate the dead from COVID-19.
attributes.additional_details: I think that the Government and Parliament should lead a wider debate about how to commemorate the dead from this dreadful pandemic. The Government should also contribute money to the local councils to help them to create a memorial that it suitable for their area.
attributes.background: The current pandemic has so far killed more than 100,000 people in the UK. Collectively the deaths highlight how fragile human life is, and hoe special it is. A memorial at local levels should highlight the people who died, and should be a reminder of what we as humans have got.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

An annual day of remembrance and memorial for the victims of the COVID-19 virus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561869

Provide funding for local initiatives to establish COVID-19 memorial arboretums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574220
